dct_title_s: A Map of the Whole World
dct_alternative_sm: New universal history of arts and sciences, shewing their origin, progress, theory, use and practice, and exhibiting the invention, structure, improvement, and uses, of the most considerable instruments, engines, and machines, with their nature, power, and operation, decyphered in fifty two copper-plates
dct_description_sm: California shown as a labeled island with a rounded northern coast with slight indentations and is visible on both the world map and America map.
Details of Europe, Asia, Africa, and America located at corners of plate with a double hemisphere map depicted at center.
"Geography." at top, "B. Cole Sculp." at bottom right, and "Plate XIX" at top right, outside the border.

Appears in "A new universal history of arts and sciences, shewing their origin, progress, theory, use and practice, and exhibiting the invention, structure, improvement, and uses, of the most considerable instruments, engines, and machines, with their nature, power, and operation, decyphered in fifty two copper-plates". London: Printed for J. Coote, 1759. 2 vols.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
